entry.title: Should you use a Shave Cream or Shave Gel ?
entry.content:
1. The first thing you need to do is sit down and set your goals. Diana Scharf Hunt said “Goals are dreams with deadlines.” A lot of times, people are thrown off by the idea of taking the time to set their goals.

     

    Keeping one’s self going is a difficult thing to do. There are a million distractions that occur every day and that can mean that we do not stay on track with what we should be doing.

    Have you ever heard the expression, “Do not count your chickens before they hatch?” Maybe an older, wiser individual would tell you this to keep you from getting ahead of yourself. Like buying a new car before you actually got that new job. Well, when setting and obtaining your goals, you need to “Count your chicken before they hatch” in your mind. What I mean by this is you have to start seeing yourself completing or obtaining your goal. What you profess, you possess!

    The first thing you need to do is sit down and set your goals. Diana Scharf Hunt said “Goals are dreams with deadlines.” A lot of times, people are thrown off by the idea of taking the time to set their goals.

entry.title: Easy Family Home Work Outs
entry.content:
Even though most of Utah has fully opened up – we’ve been having fun doing some quick family work outs. Sometimes they are 30 minutes other days they are 10 minutes, it’s just a fun way to play as a family.

FAMILY SQUATS:

I hold ollie in the front and Cody throws Beckam on his back for a little extra weight.  My legs are still burning from the other day haha.

entry.title: 4 Ways To Wear A Button-Up Shirt
entry.content: Hey guys! I wanted to share the ‘Best of’ multiple categories from the Nordstrom Sale, from footwear to beauty to home. Let me know if there are other categories you guys want to see a round-up from – men, baby, bags… whatever! Starting off with the Best of the Anniversary Sale… shoes!

entry.title: 5 Days Of Simple Summer Looks
entry.content: Summer days can be unpredictable. With kids out of school, we are always in search or something new to keep everyone entertained or the next adventure. It can be difficult to even find a time to work let alone get ready for the day, so I put it to the test- how fast can I throw together 5 easy outfits for every occasion throughout the week. The goal was to still look stylish and put together, but keep it simple and quick! Here are 5 days of simple summer looks for various occasions.

entry.title: Matching Mom-Daughter Suit
entry.content: Fruit prints are back on the rise this summer and the high-schooler in me is here for it. It feels like such a throwback and I love the way it’s bringing in so many colors to this seasons print trends! Summersalt just launched their Cherries collection and Mara and I both got a few pieces. It’s been so much fun twinning with her, especially now that’s she’s starting to fit into some of the brands I love and wear a lot. This wrap skirt is one of my favorite pieces – it comes in multiple prints and so good as a beach cover up but can also transition to brunch or dinner out with a cropped tee or bodysuit. The perfect vacation piece! Right now you can get $10 towards your order with code: HELLOFASHION10 (orders over $95).

entry.title: Master Bathroom Reveal
entry.content: We had this custom art made for our bathroom, but she is actually selling prints of it now in her shop. She is a super talented local artist in Utah her name is Christie Adelle. You guys know how much we love the sunset and the beach so I love bringing that little piece of joy into our space when we are relaxing each night.
